Two hundred...two fifty... Bryan chambers a round. Ali hits the button.
Three,..three fifty...four... The bidding is fast and furious.
Four fifty... There i8 a pause.  92.
Four fifty...four fifty... Ali does not move. Bryan hits the button.
Five hundred thousand...five hundred...five hundred... No response.
Sold. As the applause comes, the window goes black.
That concludes the sale for tonight. Thank you all for coming. You can collect your purchases directly.
Let's go.
You will never get away with this.
If you want to live, you'll make sure I do. Move. He pushes Ali toward the door.

The door opens. Ali exits, Bryan right behind him. Becaus the walls are curved, Bryan has no field of vision. No so has Bryan stepped out, then two blackjacks from both side of the curved wall come crashing down on his head.
Bryan's vision clears. He finds himself in a tool shop, handcuffed to an overhead pipe, facing four Security men and...
Now Mr... He looks at Bryan's fake ID...
Well, we know you are not Mr. Jean- Claude. He holds up the ID, peels Bryan's picture off.  93. sT. CLAIR So what do we call you? Bryan says nothing.
Doesn't matter what we call you really. What does matter is what you are doing here. Would you care to tell me what you are doing here?
The last girl. I'm her father. This causes some disquiet among the men.
Oh my.
Give her to me.

IT wish I could, honestly. I'ma father also. Two sons and a daughter. But let me explain something to you Mr...whoever you are. This is a business. A very unique business with a very unique clientele.
T'll pay.

In this business there are no refunds, no returns, no discounts, no buy backs. All sales are final. Besides discretion, it is the only rule we have. As a father, my heart goes out to you. It really does. Asa businessman, I must accept the reality. I'm sorry. St. Clair turns to go.
What should we do with him? At the door...
Kill him. (beat) Quietly. I have guests. St. Clair exits with one of the Security men. The other three men look at each other. }  94. Then at Bryan, who glares at them.

Gag him. Man 3 takes out a cloth, the other two take out knives. M 3 advances on Bryan. As he gets within range, Bryan pulls down with all his might on the pipe he is handcuffed to, snaps it. The open pipe spews a blast of steam right into Man 3's face. He staggers back, blinded, scalded. Steam begins to fill the room. Man 2 rushes Bryan, leadin with his knife. Bryan wraps the handcuffs around his fore spins halfway, breaks his arm. When, from behind, Man 1 pulls a garrote tight around Bry throat. Bryan reverses fast, gets his handcuffs around th man's neck, pulls hard, snaps his neck like a twig. Man 3 has recovered and charges Bryan with his knife draw Bryan reverses him with a swift deflection and drives him forward, right into the dangling steam pipe. The pipe pie his back and protrudes through his chest; blood sprays in every direction. As he dies, steam shoots out of the pipe Bryan reaches over, removes a gun from the holster of one the dead men, shoots the handcuffs off.
St. Clair is waiting for the lift, when he hears the shot
Would you please go and see which part of the word quietly they did not understand?

Yes sir. The Security Man heads back toward the rear door, when th door swings open and a burst of steam envelops him. Out o the steam a gun fires, blowing a hole in his face. St. Clair stares, stunned, as Bryan emerges from the stea armed. Fire in his eyes.
(panicked) We can resolve this. Bryan says nothing, keeps advancing. St. Clair backs up against the lift door.

I know how you feel. We should talk. We'll work it out.  95. The lift door opens, St. Clair stumbles in , tries to pus the button. Bryan fires one shot, wounding him in his shoulder. St. Clair slumps against the wall, Bryan stands over him.
You have no idea... Bryan puts a bullet in his other shoulder. St. Clair scre Bryan aims the gun at his leg.
Where is she?
Please you must try to understand... Bryan puts a bullet in his leg.
There's a boat by the quay! Please understand. It was all business. It wasn't personal.
To you it was all business. To me it was all personal. He pumps the entire clip of bullets into St. Clair. Press the lift button. The doors close. The lift rises.
The guests are mingling, chatting, being so pleasantly so when the lift arrives, opens, and St. Clair's lifeless, b body topples out. A real party ender.
Guests are rushing out of the mansion, hampering the Secu men trying to rush in. Suddenly...
One of the luxury cars from the garage comes smashing thr the garage doors to the side of the main building, Bryan behind the wheel.

Bryan veers off, avoiding hitting the people scurrying ar The Security draw guns, try to get a bead on him, but Bry jerks the car to the left, without taking his foot off th accelerator, sending the car crashing through a high hedg  96.

Bryan races the car through the formal gardens of the man destroying a large fountain, tearing up the plantings, obliterating several benches and a glass gazebo, smashing through the wall surrounding the whole estate, before he careens onto the road.

Bryan emerges onto the top of the Avenue, sees in the distance, on the river below, a grand boat, built in the Twenties, made all of wood and gleaming chrome, lit up, w several cars approaching. Bryan hits the accelerator, takes a road to the lower qua
Ali and his bodyguards bring Kim and two other drugged ou girls onto the boat. More bodyguards greet them on deck.

Bryan races along the river on the lower roadway, sees th the boat has left the quai and moved out into the river. Bryan screeches to a stop as the road dead ends, throws t Car into reverse, goes barreling up the road the way he c
On the top of the roadway, traffic runs in the opposite direction. Out of nowhere, Bryan's car blows out of the lower roadway and onto the high quai road. AGAINST THE FL

Cars screech, bang into each other. Bryan sees from his vantage point that the boat has pulled away from the quai and is starting to head out into the river. Bryan jams the gear shift into low, and takes off after t boat. AGAINST THE FLOW OF TRAFFIC. TRACK WITH Bryan as he races against the traffic, keeping one eye on the boat cruising in the middle of the river, the other eye on the cars trying to get out of his way as barrels full speed right at them. Cars careen left and right, slamming into each other, run up on the shoulders of the road, taking out lampposts, gu rails. Bryan pulls even with the boat, still racing headlong int the traffic. Oblivious to the mayhem he is causing, he lo over toward the boat, see several crewmen on deck, but no Sign of Ali or Kim.  97.
Ali enters a stateroom where an older man in Traditional robes, SHEIKH RAHMAN, is reclining on a huge bed.
(Arabic) They are being prepared sir.

Bryan races down the road until he comes to a bridge ahea of the boat. He brakes hard, gets out, and starts running to the center of the bridge. He perches right at the rail, waiting for the boat to com closer. On the quai road, the sound of police sirens and the sigh of flashing lights heading right towards him draws Bryan' attention for a moment.
Ali, walking along a corridor hears the noise outside, pe out a window, sees the police cars rushing up the quai, t nothing of it, heads for a door at the end of the hall.
Bryan watches the boat passing underneath the bridge some thirty fee below. He takes a breath, jumps.
Ali watches as two Arabic women are dressing Kim and the other spaced out girls in very chic, but very revealing g
Show time! And then he hears a loud thump on the deck above.

Bryan has hit the deck hard, injuring his ankle. Taking a moment to collect himself, he looks up to see three crewm running towards him, two have clubs, the third a shovel. Bryan manages to find his feet just as they attack. The first man swings his club. Bryan disarms him, crippli him with a blow to the throat. He raises the club just as the shovel comes crashing down, blocking the sharp edge o it and driving the club into the man's jaw in one swift m  98. The third man catches him with the club across the back. Bryan buckles a bit from the blow. The man is about to la another, when Bryan kicks out from the floor, shattering man's knee. The man goes down, screaming in pain. Bryan puts him out his misery with a reverse elbow strike to the face.
Ali moves through the corridor, the three dazed girls bei hustled along by two other men, when he sees, through the narrow window above him, a man hitting the deck, blood spurting from his mouth.
You! He motions to one man.
Come with me! Motions to the other.
You deliver the girls! Ali and one of the men run off.

Bryan makes his way along the deck, favoring his injured ankle, when suddenly a door opens behind him and two men rush out, one with an ax, the other with a machete. Bryan grabs the only weapon available: the oar from a lif boat. Bryan battles both men, skillfully using the oar to defle the blows from the ax and the machete, spinning, feinting blocking, striking, until the man with the machete snaps Oar in two with one downward cut. Just then the man with the ax swings at Bryan. Bryan bloc the blow with one end of the oar, jams the jagged other e into his chest. In one swift circular move, Bryan grabs t ax, Spins, and buries the blade into the chest of the mac wielder. Bryan hears a noise behind him, turns just as two more me emerge, firing guns. Bryan pulls the man he just axed in Front of him. The bullets riddle his body. Bryan spins with the corpse, grabbing the machete, swingi down at the shooter's hands. Chops one man's hand clean off. Severs the second shooter's throat.  99. Another man emerges from the cabin, spraying with an automatic. Bryan pushes the corpse into him, clambers up and over the cabin roof.

head_text.subj: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DECK

text: Bryan drops back down onto the deck, his ankle crumbling underneath him. He rises, painfully, only to find another three crew, armed with clubs, and knives, charging. The first man attacks with a knife. Bryan lets the knife pass inches from his side, then spins the man and drives knife into the second man who is charging right behind hi The third man swings down with his club, catches Bryan on the shoulder, sends him staggering almost over the side o the boat. The Clubber swings again, Bryan rolls over the rail, latc onto a rope attached to the side, uses the rope to block next blow. He wraps the rope around the man's wrist and pulls. The man flies over the rail, into the river. Bryan clambers back onto the deck, barely has time to cat his breath, when a bullet smashes into the wall next to h head. He turns to the two gunmen, and Ali, coming over th top of the roof. With nowhere to run, he dives through th window leading inside the boat.

Bryan lands in the interior corridor, just as two more me come around the corner, with automatic weapons. They fire. Bryan yanks open a door, which takes the barra of bullets. When the smoke clears, there is no movement from behind t door. The men rush the door, swing it open. There is no one there. | The men run forward, turn the corner, right into two grap hooks, that embed in their chests. Each hook held in one Bryan's hands. Bryan sees a door at the far end of the corridor, grabs o of the automatic weapons from the men he just dispatched, heads towards the door as fast as his bum ankle will carr him. Suddenly from outside on the deck, gunfire shatters the windows, rakes the corridor, tearing the wooden walls. Bryan runs, returns the fire through the windows as he go One man outside falls, another falls. Then Bryan takes a bullet in the arm, loses his weapon as he hits the floor.  100. Bryan struggles up, his arm bleeding, pulls himself up on the shredded wood of the wall, when Ali drops down the st pistol in hand.

You! He raises his pistol to fire. Bryan's hand, clutching the wooden wall, yanks a board free, and just as Ali fires, h dives forward, somersaults, and comes up right in front o Ali, buries the board in his hand in Ali's forehead. The exposed nails pierce Ali's brain. Ali's eyes stare into Bryan's, go lifeless. Bryan pushes him aside, ignores his own wound, picks up Ali's pistol a limps for the door at the end of the hall. Just as he approaches the door, a shot rings out from ins pierces the door. Bryan falls. The door opens, and Sheikh Rahman appears, pistol in hand Behind him, Kim and the other girls are huddled on the be Rahman stands over Bryan, regards him for a moment, then turns back to the room. He hears a noise. Turns again to Bryan, standing, bloodied.

Party's over. Rahman raises his pistol. Not as fast as Bryan. Bryan dri one shot right through Rahman's forehead. Rahman falls to the floor, dead. Bryan steps into the room, sees Kim on the bed. She looks at him with glazed, drugged eyes. He goes to her.
Kim. She looks up at him, uncomprehending at first, then...
Daddy... Her eyes light with recognition.
You came for me. She starts to cry.
You came for me. She wraps her arms around him, sobs.  101.
I told you I would. He holds her close.

The doors to Customs open. Kim emerges, runs into the arms of Lenore. Stuart stands close. Bryan emerges from Customs a moment later, arm in sling, leaning on a cane, favoring his ankle, face bruise and cut, slow to heal.
Bryan... He holds out his hand.
If there's anything you need.
IT have what I need. Referring to Kim.
Bryan. She hugs him, awkward, but heartfelt.
Thank you. The awkwardness persists. They separate.
Come on darling. We're going to go home. lLuisa's preparing that chocolate souffle just the way you like it. We'll rent some films, cuddle up. Marc will come over tomorrow for your hair...
Mom... Lenore stops.
If it's OK with you, I think I'm going to spend the night at Dad's. Lenore is stunned. But not as stunned as...  102.
Honey. It's OK. You don't have to.

I know I don't have to. (beat) I want to. A small smile breaks across Bryan's lips, nothing in comparison to the one that fills his heart. Kim puts her arm through his. They walk off, arm in arm. As Lenore and Stuart watch them exit into the bright California day. 3-28-06
